comments:
In the 20050623-1200 examples build, I cannot open the undo example views (Box 
View and Undo History View.)  I get a Class not found exception (appended 
below).

Wassim suggested a fix to the build.properties file, but I'm not sure it's 
working, as the built jar only has the jar itself inside it.  So something is 
not right.  Note that it runs fine from a runtime workspace.  I'll release the 
changes Wassim suggested to the build, but I need help on this one - there is 
still a problem...

Here's the exception.

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.eclipse.ui.examples.undo.views.BoxView
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass
(BundleLoader.java:403)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.findClass
(BundleLoader.java:350)
	at 
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.adaptor.core.AbstractClassLoader.loadClass
(AbstractClassLoader.java:78)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleLoader.loa
Should this example be built as a jar'd plug-in?
I will need to update the org.eclipse.sdk.examples feature if yes.
I have updated and released the feature for the midnight build.

Susan, I exported your plugin with the build.properties as it appears in HEAD 
and it worked great.

Perhaps, you didn't use the Plug-in export wizard?

I used File>Export>Deployable Plug-ins and Fragments.
Not sure if that is what you meant.

the broken plugin was initially flat in your install.
the one you exported was a self-contained JAR.

Could it be that you forgot to delete the old one from your install and you 
ended up with two and the bad (old) won?

In any event, it's all fine so this bug can be closed.

When I tried it last night, I had deleted the old install (plug-in folder) and 
added the JAR.  At that point, the view didn't even show up in the Show View 
menu.  I must've exported it wrong, as the JAR did not look like it should.  

Fixed now, though.
